# Docker Hytale Server Container

## Project Overview
Docker Hytale Server Container is a production-ready containerized solution for hosting Hytale dedicated game servers. This project provides automated binary management, cross-platform support, and built-in diagnostic tools for running Hytale servers in Docker environments.

## Key Features
- Fast server startup (7 seconds with CACHE=TRUE)
- Automated Hytale server binary downloads and updates via hytale-downloader CLI
- Multi-architecture support (x86_64, ARM64 planned)
- Built-in debug mode for network and security auditing
- Optimized Alpine and Ubuntu-based Docker images
- Volume and bind mount support for persistent data
- Production and development environment configurations

## Technology Stack
- Docker and Docker Compose
- Alpine Linux and Ubuntu base images
- Java/JVM runtime (Liberica and standard JDK variants)
- Bash scripting for automation
- Jekyll for documentation site

## Installation Methods
1. Docker CLI: Single command deployment with docker run
2. Docker Compose: YAML-based configuration for persistent setups
3. Platform-specific guides for TrueNAS Scale, Unraid, Windows WSL2

## Environment Variables
- SERVER_IP: Server bind address (default: 0.0.0.0)
- SERVER_PORT: Game server port (default: 5520)
- PROD: Production mode toggle (TRUE/FALSE)
- DEBUG: Enable diagnostic tools (TRUE/FALSE)
- TZ: Timezone configuration
- CACHE: Enable fast startup caching

## Storage
- Bind mount: ./data:/home/container for local file access
- Volume mount: Named Docker volumes for managed storage
- Persistent storage for game files, world data, and configurations

## Authentication
Server requires Hytale account authentication via web-based flow during initial setup and server startup

## Community
- 10+ active contributors
- 150+ Discord community members
- GitHub repository for issues and feature requests
- Active support channels for troubleshooting

## Documentation Structure
- Installation requirements and prerequisites
- Container installation guides (CLI and Compose)
- Server running and authentication steps
- Platform-specific deployment guides
- FAQ and troubleshooting
- Technical documentation for Docker, security, and Hytale specifics

## Use Cases
- Self-hosting Hytale game servers
- Testing mods and custom configurations
- Running persistent multiplayer worlds
- Development and production server deployments
- Multi-platform server hosting

## License
Apache 2.0

## Repository
https://github.com/deinfreu/hytale-server-container

## Documentation
https://hytale-server-container.com

## Docker Hub
https://hub.docker.com/r/deinfreu/hytale-server

Perfect for Docker Hytale self-hosting with Docker Compose, this container provides a consistent environment in one command.
